title: China: Winners of the Seventh Annual 'Citi Cup' Financial IT Application Competition Announced in Chengdu
summary: Chengdu, China - The winners of the seventh annual "Citi Cup" Financial Information Technology Application Competition were announced today in Chengdu, at the Southwestern University of Finance and Economics (SWUFE). After six months of preparation, pre-screening and a two-day final competition, a team from Wuhan University won the highly-coveted Citi Cup award vs. a field of 180 teams. The team won for its project that examined "Investment System that Quantifies Futures."
tag-1: China: Winners of the Seventh Annual 'Citi Cup' Financial IT Application Competition Announced in Chengdu
tag-2: Chengdu, China – The winners of the seventh annual "Citi Cup" Financial Information Technology Application Competition were announced today in Chengdu, at the Southwestern University of Finance and Economics (SWUFE). After six months of preparation, pre-screening and a two-day final competition, a team from Wuhan University won the highly-coveted Citi Cup award vs. a field of 180 teams. The team won for its project that examined "Investment System that Quantifies Futures."
tag-3: Yu Jin, Executive Vice President and Country Human Resources Officer for Citi China; Richard Ho Sang, General Manager of Citicorp Software Technology Services (CSTS); Feng Xide, Secretary of the Party committee of SWUFE, and local government officials attended the award ceremony.
tag-4: Mr. Yu Jin said, "Citi has been a leading supporter of financial IT education in China for many years, and we are delighted with the success of the Citi Cup competition. We will continue to engage with a wide range of universities with the aim of helping to expand the financial IT talent pool in China."
tag-5: Mr. Richard Ho Sang said, "This is the seventh year that Citi Cup has been conducted, and we are proud that the competition is stronger than ever. It is pleasing to witness the 180 teams that participated and to see the students applying their knowledge to design real projects that improve the quality of service, products and security in financial services applications."
tag-6: Mr. Feng Xide said, "The combination of finance and IT has brought unprecedented change to our economic life. The competition is an excellent platform for this combination and for the participants to present team work and innovations, which will help them make great achievements for the future development of the country."
tag-7: The Citi Cup Financial IT Application Competition started in 2005. It has successfully built a bridge between academia and the financial IT industry, resulting in better communication on cultivating the IT talent pipeline support of the financial sector. More than 1,100 students from 47 universities took part in this year's competition. A number of prizes were awarded, including Best Mainframe Product and Best Rural Financial Product. Students from the top-20 teams will have the opportunity to interview for an internship at CSTS.
